definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Attainable-Realistic means uninspiring and status quo.
sentences.chinese: 現實性意味着沒那麼刺激與安於現狀。

sentences.english: They never seem content with their present situation.
sentences.chinese: 他們似乎從不安於現狀。

sentences.english: But Gemini bosses are never satisfied with the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 但雙子座的上司從不安於現狀。

definition: clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career
lit. to be confined within a circle drawn on the ground (idiom)/fig. to confine oneself to a restricted range of activities
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
